Raggett and Ben-Natan example

Dave Raggett and Or Ben-Natan (W3C "Voice browsers" note) propose markup for navigational choice: 
<P onselecttimeout='document.speak(
  "You have not entered any selection, 
   please enter your selection now")'>
  <A href=Instructions.html>Directions</A> 
  <A href=Todo>List of things to do</A>
</P>
Looks like contents!

But onselecttimeout indicates that the hyperlinks are not to be construed as optional links

This HTML snippet is intended as a kind of dialog

It seems contrary to markup language philosophy that such structure is not expressed explicitly
